meanings.definition: A person who annoys or provokes others with criticism or questioning.
meanings.sent1: The gadflies in the meeting always ask too many questions.
meanings.sent2: Journalists can sometimes be seen as gadflies by politicians.
meanings.sent3: The gadflies at the party kept pointing out flaws in the decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her words buzzed around him like persistent gadflies, never giving him peace.
meanings.sent5: The gadflies of the classroom were the students who never stopped challenging the teacher.

meanings.definition: A fly that bites or annoys livestock.
meanings.sent1: The farmer had to shoo away the gadflies bothering his cows.
meanings.sent2: Gadflies can make it difficult for animals to relax in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gadflies seemed to enjoy bothering the horses.
meanings.sent4: The gadflies hovered around the cattle, causing them to become restless.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing of gadflies filled the air around the barnyard.
